com.keyboardr.glassremote.common.receiver

Class StringMessageReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.keyboardr.glassremote.common.receiver.StringMessageReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MessageReceiver<String>

    public class StringMessageReader
extends Object
implements MessageReceiver<String>
    Reads messages and converts them to Strings. Messages are separated by '\n' characters.
    Author:
    Joshua Brown

      • read

        public boolean read(MessageReceiver.OnReceiveMessageListener<? super String> listener)
        Description copied from interface: MessageReceiver
        Reads messages from the InputStream. Any number of messages may be read on each call so long as MessageReceiver.OnReceiveMessageListener.onReceiveMessage(Object) is called for each message. For simplicity it may be easiest for implementations to read one message per call. If no data is immediately available on the InputStream , this method blocks until data becomes available or the InputStream is closed.
        Specified by:
        read in interface MessageReceiver<String>
        Parameters:
        listener - the callback to send messages to
        Returns:
        true if the InputStream can still be read from, false if it is closed or otherwise unreadable
